result.execSummary:
All charges against Marc Bennett in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marc Bennett is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Arraignment on March 24, 2022 at 12:30 pm.

It is hereby ordered that the defendant's motion to modify bail to allow the defendant to have supervised telephone contact with his 2 minor children is granted.
It is hereby ordered that the defendant's Motion to modify bail and lower the cash amount is hereby denied.
Amended Commitment for Failure to Furnish Cash Bail.

1:32 PM Defendant Marc Bennett appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Jonathan Carver Smith appeared in court for Marc Bennett, Attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense has filed a motion to dismiss Count 5. The State has not had a chance to review the motion. The Court reserves the right for the motion to be heard.
Testimony presented. Argument. 
The Court finds that probable cause exists that the defendant has committed a felony. 
Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings. 
BOND MOTION
The court will accept the stipulation and modify the condition to allow supervised telephone contact with the defendant's two minor children. 
The court finds that the cash as set is appropriate and denies the motion. 
Minutes.

RE:  Attempted 1st degree sexual assault of child, between 01-13-22 and 02-01-22.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.
Order for Prints.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of use computer to facilitate a sex crime, soliciting child for prostitution, attempted sexual assault of child and resist officer.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 02-07-22 at 1:30 pm, Br. 2.  Bail is set at $100,000.00 cash with the conditions that he have no contact with any person under the age of 18 years old and defendant is not to use or possess any internet enabled devices.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Minutes.
